Welcome to SenSE - a joint project by the Julius and Rensselaer High Frequency Integrated Circuits (RHFIC) Labs at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.


 We are working toward an optimized life experience.


 The app is in the first stages of analyzing your circadian rhythm, which will eventually allow us build an ecosystem targeted at increasing overall wakefulness and cognitive alertness.


To do this, we analyze your heart rate from Fitbit and extract the circadian component. More information is available on the Visualization page

The circadian rhythm plays a vital role in our overall well-being. From our sleep patterns and alertness, to our body temperature and metabolism, our circadian rhythm can have huge effects on how we feel.\n\n As you can imagine,

SenSE is an ongoing project with contributors from the Julius and Rensselaer High Frequency Integrated Circuits (RHFIC) Labs at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.\n\n We\'re a group of researchers focused on improving our understanding of circadian dynamics with the hope of doing some good with that knowledge.
The app requests your HR data from Fitbit and processes it on your phone. Everything is kept encrypted on your phone, and we never have access to your data.
Why is your circadian health important?

The graph above shows your raw heart rate from Fitbit overlayed with the filtered output which we take to be your circadian rhythm.


 We get this output by isolating 3 harmonics from the heart rate, which allow us estimate how your rhythm progresses over the day.


 The algorithm is based on an Observer-Based-Filter that was developed by our lab.
